topic.title: Tried to install, zeronet homepage empty
topic.body:
Wanted to install zeronet on a friend's computer, after telling him how cool decentralized technology was. Utter failure, empty zeronet homepage.

I guess I spent all his goodwill right then and there... what a shame. You should really be more careful to properly test installation and so on...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12527514/51248443-0fa18100-1988-11e9-9e87-ed20476406c3.png)

1604067084_mirrored_pdrmend_github.body:
My friend says I was too harsh... The truth is, Zeronet is technically brilliant, I have huge admiration for its developer, but then it fails on something as basic as fking first time instalation... It is not the first time I have felt that user friendliness is being hugely neglected.

Something might be a great technical achievement, and yet fail to have any impact because of things like this. Let that be food for thought.
